question: I received a spinal epidural injection in my lumbar area for spinal stenosis and almost immediately began to have severe left arm and left shoulder pain.  It has been 10 days since the injection and I feel this is actually getting worse.  I couldn't sleep last night because of this pain.  It starts in my left back left shoulder and radiates down my arm.  It isn't sharp but is constant.  I have diabetes 2 but am not overweight.   I had a qaudruple by-pass 3 years ago and following that was diagnosed with diabetes the first time.  My blood pressure is fine.  The doctor told me that my blood sugar might spike following the injection and it did, in spite of the medication I take for it.  It spiked to between 300 and 400 for two days, but is fine now.  When it was spiking, my arm pain would seem to get much worse.
title: steriod shot ends in severe shoulder  and arm pain
